text.p: These are the leading stories in the Lebanese press on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Two Lebanese dead, two wounded in Sierra Leone violence.
- Israeli air raid on the hills of Ain al-Teeneh, an hour after the wounding of two South Lebanon Army militiamen.
- Solidere to cancel shares worth $170 million.
- Treasury bill issue raises 291.5 billion pounds. Nominal surplus of subscription against maturity at 128 billion pounds.
- Parliament Speaker Berri: Government to be questioned over a number of issues during Wednesday's parliamentary session.
- Public school teachers on strike on Wednesday.
- Lebanon industrialists urged to export to Iraq, Romania, Africa and the Far East.
- Bashar Assad, son of Syrian President Hafez Assad, in Bkerki soon to hand invitation to Maronite Patriarch Sfeir to visit Damascus.
